metadata.feature_description: Searches and selects users and roles for permission assignment and sharing

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Access Permissions Tab for User/Role Search

steps.action: Navigate to Assets panel and select My Website folder
steps.expected: Folder list should display with available folders
steps.actual: Folder list displayed successfully with folders including Images, PermissionsTestFolder, etc.

steps.action: Hover on a folder to reveal action icons
steps.expected: Action icons (edit, move, delete) should appear on the folder card
steps.actual: Action icons appeared correctly on hover

steps.action: Click edit icon to open folder details panel
steps.expected: Folder details panel should open with Details and Permissions tabs
steps.actual: Folder details panel opened, but an error appeared: 'Could not load type Dnn.PersonaBar.Library.Dto.Permissions from assembly Dnn.PersonaBar.Library, Version=10.1.1.0'

steps.action: Click on Permissions tab to access User/Role Search functionality
steps.expected: Permissions tab should display role permissions grid and user search functionality
steps.actual: Permissions tab content is completely empty - no role grid, no user search box, no permissions controls visible due to the type loading error

issues: Critical Error: 'Could not load type Dnn.PersonaBar.Library.Dto.Permissions from assembly Dnn.PersonaBar.Library, Version=10.1.1.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null'
Permissions tab fails to load - content area is completely empty
User and Role Search functionality is inaccessible due to permissions panel loading failure

observations: Code review confirms SearchUser() endpoint exists at Services/AssetsController.cs:790-809 which searches users by DisplayName and returns up to 5 results
Code review confirms GetRoles() endpoint exists at Services/AssetsController.cs:778-788 which returns all roles for permission assignment
The folder details panel opens correctly with Details tab functional (Name, Workflow, Versioning settings work)
The type loading error suggests a version mismatch or missing assembly reference in the Dnn.PersonaBar.Library assembly
This appears to be an infrastructure/deployment issue rather than a feature code bug
